intro: Sphaeranthus gomphrenoides, commonly known as the globe thistle, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, spherical flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, displaying adaptations such as hairy foliage to reduce water loss. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, with prominent central disk florets surrounded by ray florets. Sphaeranthus gomphrenoides is often found in rocky soils and is known for its drought tolerance and ability to thrive in harsh conditions.
